heading: contributors
subheading: paul bennett (sadie@el.net) lives in and writes from the lower east side. paul boutin (paul@hotbot.com) is hotbot’s product manager for business development. jon caramanica (jon@tracemag.com) is editor at large of trace magazine. jason cook is a project manager at hotbot. adrienne day was first published at the age of 10 with “in search of song,” […]
author: wired staff
text: paul bennett (sadie@el.net) lives in and writes from the lower east side.paul boutin (paul@hotbot.com) is hotbot's product manager for business development.jon caramanica (jon@tracemag.com) is editor at large of trace magazine.jason cook is a project manager at hotbot.adrienne day was first published at the age of 10 with "in search of song," a booklet of poems.craig e. engler is the editor of science fiction weekly (www.scifiweekly.com).darren gladstone is staff writer on mobile computing and communications at pc week.seth kaplan (kaplanse@yahoo.com) is currently writing show me the monkey (my days at national geographic television).clare kleinedler is a contributing editor at addicted to noise.scott mckim (smckim@hollywoodreporter.com) is an editor at the hollywood reporter.michael menduno (m2aqua@worldnet.att.net) is a freelance writer and avid diver who likes to get in over his head.mitch myers (comeback@mcs.com) is a psychologist and freelance writer.randall rothenberg is author of where the suckers moon: an advertising story.glenn rubenstein is a 23-year-old writer living in northern california. in addition to his writing endeavors, he fronts the alt rock-rap-pop group headboard.luis sala (luis@primogen.com) is director of web development at epicentric in san francisco.tony scherman is the author of backbeat: earl palmer's story (smithsonian press).jonathan seff (jon@seff.net) is an assistant editor at macworld and a music writer living in san francisco.dean suzuki, phd, teaches music history at san francisco state university. he is also a programmer at kpfa in berkeley, california.scott taves (staves@leapnet.com) is an entertainment writer and digital strategist at online-marketing agency quantum leap.david weinberger edits the journal of the hyperlinked organization (www.hyperorg.com).joe wiesenfelder (joe@cars.com), a senior producer of cars.com, loves audio too much to make it his full-time job anymore.got an idea for street cred?
